thread.title: Gaga’s Performance Wasn’t Progressive Enough for Hillary, So She Took Matters Into Her Own Hands…
thread.title_full: Gaga’s Performance Wasn’t Progressive Enough for Hillary, So She Took Matters Into Her Own Hands…

author: Nickarama
title: Gaga’s Performance Wasn’t Progressive Enough for Hillary, So She Took Matters Into Her Own Hands…
text:
05:25pm February 6, 2017 Do you like this article? 
When Lady Gaga sang during the Super Bowl, some were expecting an overt political statement criticizing President Donald Trump. 
But it didn’t happen and some liberals actually went after Gaga for her failure to attack Trump. 
Some interpreted her singing of “This Land Is Your Land” as a subtle jab at Trump. 
But if that was meant to be an attack, it went over most people’s heads. 
Gaga actually seemed to be concentrating on what she was there to do, which was to sing. 
She sang parts of “God Bless America,”“This Land is Your Land” and recited parts of the Pledge of Allegiance. 
But if Gaga’s message didn’t appear to be sufficiently preachy, someone tried to make sure if we missed it, that there was a “message” for us to learn. I'm one of 100 million #SuperBowl fans that just went #Gaga for the Lady, & her message to all of us. https://t.co/8AoNqjwr1b 
— Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) February 6, 2017 
Pro-tip: Hillary, if you don’t put a clear message out there, people aren’t going to see it and maybe it isn’t really there. 
You should understand that by now. 
You didn’t have a message apart from, “Elect me, it’s my time” and “The other guy is awful.” 
You had to get people to paint you as more than you were just as you are trying to paint Gaga’s performance as something more than it was. 
Not buying it…
